# Gooffy Java Instructions

These instructions guide Gooffy when assisting with Java code.

## Code Style
- Use standard Java naming conventions (camelCase for variables/methods, PascalCase for classes).
- Prefer interfaces and abstract classes for extensibility.
- Use JavaDoc comments for public classes and methods.

## Explanations
- When explaining Java concepts, provide clear, concise examples.
- Use comments to clarify complex logic.

## Testing
- Suggest or create unit tests using JUnit.

## Example
- When asked to explain inheritance, provide a simple code snippet and a brief explanation.
